wikipedia_page.main: Mary Germaine is an English film actress.

response: The 1952 Warner Brothers film was directed by David Butler. Some scenes in the movie were filmed in Oxford, England (where the story takes place), yet the movie makes almost no attempt to take advantage of these authentic locations. The film's cast starred Ray Bolger, Allyn Ann McLerie and Horace Cooper repeating their stage roles, and Robert Shackleton as Jack Chesney, Mary Germaine as Kitty Verdun, and Howard Marion-Crawford as Sir Francis Chesney.Crowther, Bosley. "Movie Review"'Where's Charley?' (1952)", The New York Times, June 27, 1952 The movie ends with each of the principal cast members taking a curtain call.
* Mary Germaine as Peggy Reece
* Mary Germaine as Brigid *
*Mary Germaine as Susan Heath, bank employee

The Floating Dutchman is a 1952 British crime film directed by Vernon Sewell and starring Dermot Walsh, Sydney Tafler and Mary Germaine. It was known as Clue for a Corpse on U.S. TV. The film was an early product of Merton Park Studios, a British company best known for its Edgar Wallace Mysteries of the 1960s. Its plot involves Dermot Walsh as a Scotland Yard detective who goes undercover amongst jewel thieves after a dead Dutchman is found floating in the river. It is based on a 1950 novel by Nicholas Bentley.
* Mary Germaine ...  Rose Reid

House of Blackmail is a 1953 British drama film directed by Maurice Elvey and starring Mary Germaine, William Sylvester and Alexander Gauge. Its plot follows a soldier and his girlfriend, who become mixed up with a blackmailer.
* Mary Germaine ...  Carol Blane

The Radio Times wrote, "not one of his (Maurice Elvey's) best efforts. We could do with more surprises, but the pace is unrelenting and there are typically solid performances from Mary Germaine, William Sylvester and John Arnatt"; and TV Guide called it "ordinary but fast paced."
* Mary Germaine as Kitty Verdun
*Mary Germaine as Margaret Lane

The Night Won't Talk is a 1952 British crime film directed by Daniel Birt and starring John Bailey, Hy Hazell and Mary Germaine. The murder of an artist's model leads the police to investigate the artistic community of Chelsea.
* Mary Germaine as Hazel Carr

Flannelfoot is a 1953 British crime film directed by  Maclean Rogers and starring Ronald Howard, Mary Germaine and Jack Watling.Chibnall & MacFarlane p.119 It was made at Walton Studios. The film's sets were designed by John Stoll.
* Mary Germaine as Kathleen Fraser, Tyrone's daughter and Fitzgerald's love interest
The Green Carnation is a 1954 British crime film directed by  John Lemont and starring Wayne Morris, Mary Germaine and Marcia Ashton.Chibnall & MacFarlane p.231
